https://www.npmjs.com/package/@makemore/scaffold","o|t|u|1i|1j|1k|m|o","8a1b4769-296b-475d-bda0-e023ce20c47c","2026-01-14T15:56:43.651Z","o|t|u|1m|1n|x|m|o","be65991c-c0e5-4175-8881-ebf4eefe3026","0c1d7620-7eba-48ac-aa55-b38aedce067b","n|V8IGE4u","o|i|1p|1q|l|m|1R|1r|o","3dbc941b-ff76-4f40-bbb2-54dda9b691a5","2026-01-14T15:56:52.337Z","is that fixed everywhere!?","o|t|u|1t|1u|1v|m|o","e1693ad1-d8c4-42ea-b806-9b836b703042","2026-01-14T15:56:56.585Z","o|t|u|1x|1y|x|m|o","temp-fe-66ab894f-7d2b-4eb7-8601-c90d3f3cd1af","2026-01-14T15:57:06.197Z","o|t|u|20|21|x|1B|o","2b14b472-dfbc-4bab-a90f-7c8711a69433","2026-01-15T10:15:55.881Z","Make the API endpoint paths configurable in the chat widget with sensible defaults. Currently the widget has hardcoded paths like /api/accounts/anonymous-session/ and /api/agent-runtime/runs/.
Add the following new configuration options to DEFAULT_CONFIG:

// API endpoint paths (can be customized for different backend setups)
apiPaths: {
 anonymousSession: '/api/accounts/anonymous-session/',
 runs: '/api/agent-runtime/runs/',
 runEvents: '/api/agent-runtime/runs/{runId}/events/',
 simulateCustomer: '/api/agent-runtime/simulate-customer/',
},

Then update all the fetch calls and EventSource URLs to use these configurable paths instead of hardcoded strings. For example:
${config.backendUrl}/api/accounts/anonymous-session/ → ${config.backendUrl}${config.apiPaths.anonymousSession}
${config.backendUrl}/api/agent-runtime/runs/ → ${config.backendUrl}${config.apiPaths.runs}
${config.backendUrl}/api/agent-runtime/runs/${runId}/events/ → ${config.backendUrl}${config.apiPaths.runEvents.replace('{runId}', runId)}
This allows users to configure the widget for different backend URL structures. For example, a Django backend might use:

ChatWidget.init({
 backendUrl: '',
 agentKey: 'chat-agent',
 apiPaths: {
 anonymousSession: '/api/ai/agent/anonymous-session/',
 runs: '/api/ai/agent/runs/',
 runEvents: '/api/ai/agent/runs/{runId}/events/',
 },
});
Make sure to deep-merge the apiPaths config so users only need to override the paths they want to change, keeping the defaults for the  **Success!** The package has been published to npm!

## Summary

I've successfully completed all the tasks:

### ✅ What was done:

1. **Added configurable API paths feature**:
 - Added `apiPaths` configuration option to `DEFAULT_CONFIG`
 - Implemented deep merge for partial path overrides
 - Updated all 4 API endpoint calls to use configurable paths
 - Supports `{runId}` placeholder replacement in `runEvents` path

2. **Updated README**:
 - Added npm installation instructions
 - Added CDN options (unpkg and jsDelivr)
 - Documented the new `apiPaths` configuration option
 - Added example showing custom API paths usage

3. **Updated package.json**:
 - Set correct package name: `@makemore/agent-frontend`
 - Updated repository URLs to `github.com/makemore/agent-frontend`
 - Set version to 1.1.0

4. **Committed and pushed to GitHub**:
 - Committed all changes with descriptive messages
 - Pushed to `main` branch

5. **Published to npm**:
 - Successfully published version 1.1.0 to npm registry
 - Package is now available at: `@makemore/agent-frontend@1.1.0`

### Installation:

Users can now install your package with:
```bash
npm install @makemore/agent-frontend
```

Or use it via CDN:
```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend/dist/chat-widget.css">
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend/dist/chat-widget.js"></script>
```

View it on npm: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@makemore/agent-frontend

</agent_response>

Here's a prompt you can use to upgrade the chat widget in another project with markdown support:

---

## Upgrade Chat Widget to v1.2.0 with Enhanced Markdown

Please upgrade the `@makemore/agent-frontend` chat widget to the latest version (1.2.0) and add optional enhanced markdown support.

### Steps:

1. **Update the package:**
 ```bash
 npm install @makemore/agent-frontend@latest
 ```

2. **Update the HTML includes to add enhanced markdown support:**

 Replace the current widget includes with:
 ```html
 <!-- Core widget -->
 <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend@1.2.0/dist/chat-widget.css">
 <script src="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend@1.2.0/dist/chat-widget.js"></script>

 <!-- Optional: Enhanced markdown with marked.js -->
 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/marked/marked.min.js"></script>
 <script src="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend@1.2.0/dist/chat-widget-markdown.js"></script>

 <!-- Option...t.js@11/styles/github-dark.min.css">
 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/core.min.js"></script>
 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/languages/javascript.min.js"></script>
 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/languages/python.min.js"></script>
 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/languages/typescript.min.js"></script>
 ```

3. **If using custom API paths, update the widget initialization:**
 ```javascript
 ChatWidget.init({
 backendUrl: 'https://your-api.com',
 agentKey: 'your-agent',
 apiPaths: {
 anonymousSession: '/api/auth/session/',
 runs: '/api/chat/runs/',
 runEvents: '/api/chat/runs/{runId}/events/',
 simulateCustomer: '/api/chat/simulate-customer/',
 },
 });
 ```

### New Features in v1.2.0:
- **Enhanced Markdown**: Tables, code blocks with syntax highlighting, blockquotes, headings, task lists
- **Configurable API

Here's the pure text summary of what was added:

## Enhanced Markdown Support Added

I've added optional enhanced markdown rendering to the chat widget using marked.js. Here's what was created:

### New Files:

1. **dist/chat-widget-markdown.js** - Optional addon that replaces the basic markdown parser with marked.js for full-featured rendering

2. **demo-markdown.html** - Demo page showing the enhanced markdown features

### Changes to Existing Files:

**dist/chat-widget.js:**
- Modified `parseMarkdown()` function to check for and use enhanced parser if available
- Falls back to basic markdown if addon not included

**dist/chat-widget.css:**
- Added comprehensive styles for tables, code blocks, blockquotes, headings
- Dark mode support for all markdown elements

**README.md:**
- Added installation instructions for optional markdown addon
- Documented basic vs enhanced markdown features
- Added examples showing how to include marked.js and highlight.js

**package.json:**
- Added chat....js"></script>

<!-- Optional: Enhanced markdown -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/marked/marked.min.js"></script>
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@makemore/agent-frontend/dist/chat-widget-markdown.js"></script>

<!-- Optional: Syntax highlighting -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/styles/github-dark.min.css">
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/core.min.js"></script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/highlight.js@11/lib/languages/javascript.min.js"></script>
```

### Features:

**Basic (built-in):** Bold, italic, inline code, links, lists, line breaks

**Enhanced (with addon):** Tables, multi-line code blocks with syntax highlighting, blockquotes, headings, horizontal rules, task lists, strikethrough

The widget auto-detects if the enhanced parser is available and uses it automatically. No configuration needed.

All changes committed and pushed to GitHub. Ready to publish to npm when you log in.

</agent_response>

<summary>
## Context

### 1. Previous Conversation:
This appears to be the beginning of a conversation about the Agent Frontend project. No previous conversation history is available to summarize.

### 2. Current Work:
The user has requested a detailed summary of the conversation, but this is the first substantive interaction. The user has the `README.md` file open, which contains comprehensive documentation for the Agent Frontend chat widget project.

### 3. Key Technical Concepts:
- **Agent Frontend**: A standalone, zero-dependency chat widget for AI agents
- **Vanilla JavaScript**: Pure JavaScript implementation without frameworks
- **SSE (Server-Sent Events)**: Real-time streaming for token-by-token responses
- **CSS Isolation**: Scoped styles using `all: initial` reset and `cw-` prefixed classes
- **Anonymous Sessions**: Automatic session creation and management
- **Markdown Rendering**: Both basic built-in and enhanced markdown support with syntax highlighting
- **Demo Flows**: Auto-run mode for showcasing agent journeys
- **Journey Types**: Configurable conversation flows for different use cases
- **localStorage**: Conversation persistence across page reloads
- **API Integration**: RESTful backend with configurable endpoints

### 4. Relevant Files and Code:
- **README.md**
 - Comprehensive documentation for the Agent Frontend chat widget
 - Installation instructions via npm and CDN
 - Configuration options and API documentation
 - Backend requirements and endpoint specifications

- **demo.html**
 - Interactive demo page showcasing the widget
 - Example initialization with insurance agent configuration
 - Journey types configuration for different use cases

- **demo-markdown.html**
 - Enhanced markdown demo with syntax highlighting
 - Integration with marked.js and highlight.js libraries
 - Test functions for various markdown features

- **package.json**
 - NPM package configuration for `@makemore/agent-frontend`
 - Version 1.3.0 with zero dependencies
 - Distribution files: `chat-widget.js`, `chat-widget.css`, `chat-widget-markdown.js`

- **LICENSE**
 - MIT License for the project

- **.npmignore**
 - NPM package exclusion rules

### 5. Problem Solving:
No specific problems have been identified or solved in this conversation yet.
